meanings.definition: A reddish-brown oxide coating on iron or steel caused by the action of moisture.
meanings.sent1: The old iron gate had a layer of rubigo that made it look rustic.
meanings.sent2: After being left outside in the rain, the metal fence developed rubigo over time.
meanings.sent3: The rubigo on the metal surface seemed to give it a vintage charm.
meanings.sent4: The rubigo on the bridge railings resembled the color of autumn leaves.
meanings.sent5: The rubigo on the antique car added character to its appearance.

meanings.sent1: If you leave the tools outside, they will rubigo and become rusty.
meanings.sent2: The neglected bike began to rubigo after being exposed to the elements.
meanings.sent3: Leaving the metal sculptures out in the rain caused them to rubigo quickly.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned ship started to rubigo, showing signs of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The old pipes in the basement tend to rubigo if not properly maintained.
